title: DSA: Ask About Down Syndrome
description:
The Down syndrome Australia, Ask about Down Syndrome app provides information about Down Syndrome, inclusion and advice on ways the community can support inclusive.

The App includes:
-	Questions and answers about supporting inclusion from people with Down syndrome 
-	good news stories that highlight inclusion in practice across communities
-	links to the Community Inclusion resources 
-	the ability to receive notifications and updates
-	the ability for users to submit their own stories and questions.

title: Speech Blubs: Language Therapy
description:
Do you need more proof? Check out the featured stories on Speech Blubs in Thrive Magazine, Autism Parenting, Brisbane Kids, Speech Chick Therapy, Beautiful Speech Life, and The Speech Teacher. Speech Blubs was also honored by winning the Social Impact award and is supported by Facebook’s Start Program.

This voice-controlled speech therapy app is designed to help kids learn new sounds and words, and to practice speaking in a stimulating, educational environment. We are proud, though a bit flabbergasted that our 1500+ activities have been used over 1,000,000 times to trigger sound and word production in toddlers, late talkers (speech delay), children with Apraxia of Speech, Autism, Down Syndrome, ADHD, and Sensory Processing Disorder.


WHY SHOULD YOU TRUST SPEECH BLUBS?

Jennifer Marron, B.S., SLP-A
I use Speech Blubs with my articulation students who have a difficult time using their lips and tongue to produce certain sounds (e.g. /b/, /p/, /th/, /l/, etc.). The clients I have used this to have so far loved it and are fully engaged. Thank you for a great application!

If that doesn’t give you confidence, you should also know that Speech Blubs
- Uses scientifically proven video modeling for effective speech development
- Has over 1500+ exercises, activities, funny hats, videos, mini-games, and more!
- Releases brand new, exciting content every week!
- Uses 25 fun activity themes – Early Sounds, When I Grow Up, Get into Shapes, Living Colors, This Is My Body, Mouth Gym, Animal Kingdom, Ride Your Wheels, Sing Along, Guess the Word, Guess the Sound, NUMB3R5, and many more!
- Has voice-activated functionality that provides a fun, interactive learning experience
- Makes fun use of special effects like funny hats and masks in real time using facial detection
- Lets you collect stickers and fill your sticker book as your child progresses
- Provides funny and educational content designed to trigger conversation

Try Speech Blubs activities for FREE!

SCIENTIFICALLY-PROVEN LEARNING TECHNIQUES
In a recent study published by the American Speech-Language-Hearing Association (ASHA), UCLA researchers proved that watching peers in real time results in MIRROR NEURONS being activated, which has been shown to be highly effective in speech development. Speech Blubs uses video modeling to create an immersive learning environment that allows children to observe their peers on video as they learn. 

NEW, REGULARLY RELEASED CONTENT!
Finally, a rare app that parents won’t mind their kids becoming absorbed in, one that provides a nearly endless supply of content for your children to enjoy, including over 1500 activities, exercises, funny hats and masks, effects, videos, mini-games, and more! Our team is always working hard to add exciting new content each and every week!

SUBSCRIPTION, PRICING & TERMS
Start with a 7-day free trial, get access to unlocked content and test out the app. To subscribe (and keep access to all the practices), you will be charged your monthly or annual subscription fee through your GooglePlay account. A recurring transaction, that will automatically renew unless you cancel your account at least 24 hours before the end of the current subscription month. You can manage your subscription, cancel anytime, or turn off auto-renewal by accessing your GooglePlay account. Any unused portion of a free trial period will be forfeited when you subscribe.

Read our full Terms & Conditions and Privacy Policy here: https://speechblubs.com/legal/privacy-policy-for-applications/

summary: Speech Therapy For Kids!
developerAddress: 3500 South DuPont Highway, Dover, County of Kent, Delaware 19901
recentChanges:
Nothing major, just some cool new mechanics for building sentences. Oh, and we also incorporated the 3 Fs: it's more fun, faster, and full of want-to-use-it-everyday kind of content!

And while you’re here… we are always happy to hear from you at hi@blubblub.org
comments: We've been trying for a while, but my 2.5 year old is not interested in trying to repeat the words. I'll likely cancel after the first year. Suggestion for the app developers: In the activities where the kids are teaching a new word, you should add a picture of the item in the corner of the screen while the kids say it. Otherwise they hear the word pronunciation over and over without getting the association to the meaning. EDIT: Yes, we sit with him using it and try to make it fun for him.

Kept seeing ads for this, so I downloaded it! Started the free trial before I decided to buy a subscription, and so glad I did! I couldn't even get a single activity done. There was no sound, the screen kept freezing and the app keeps force closing. Waste of time.

If I could give it a zero I really would as I should've read the reviews first before purchasing. This App is an absolute disaster, waste of time energy and money. I paid for the free trial and the available activities for my 24 month old son to use are so limited with only one activity in each section. I am trying to cancel subscription after ten mins of use its proving to be a headache and not that simple. Can someone pls advise and instruct me on how to cancel subscription ASAP pls. Thanks

On android you do have child lock like you do on iOS, also when it comes to pressing the buttons on the screen the entire screen is active so of my son holds the device with his left thumb on the screen he can't complete the actions like skip forward it take a photo as it doesn't use multi touch. Such a shame that they add these to iOS but not Android.
My 3 year old lost interest quick. Only part she liked was the photo filters.

title: Language and Cognitive Therapy for Children (MITA)
description:
• THE FIRST AND ONLY LANGUAGE THERAPY APPLICATION SUPPORTED BY CLINICAL DATA: 
In a 3-year clinical trial of 8,766 children with autism, young children who trained with MITA improved their language score at the end of the trial on average 3-times more than similar children who did not use MITA. See results at ClinicalTrials.gov/ct2/show/results/NCT02708290. 

• Includes unlimited language and cognitive exercises designed to last for 10 years

• Used by over 1,000,000 children with language delay

• Best Autism App on the Healthline’s list

• Available in English, Spanish, Portuguese, Russian, German, French, Italian, Arabic, Farsi, and Chinese.

Mental Imagery Therapy for Autism (MITA) is a unique, early-intervention application for children with language delay and autism. MITA trains mental integration and language, starting with simple vocabulary, and progressing towards higher forms of language, such as adjectives, verbs, pronouns, and syntax.


MITA EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES

• Based on ABA techniques of visual-visual and auditory-visual conditional discrimination.
• Based on language therapy technique of following directions with increasing complexity.
• Based on Pivotal Response Treatment that targets development of response to multiple cues. 
• Each activity is adaptive and delivers exercises that are at the exact level of difficulty appropriate for your child at any given point in time
• Identify colors, patterns and sizes
• Integrate objects into a unified picture
• Spatial Prepositions: on/under/behind/in front
• Time prepositions: Before/After
• Passive verb tense
• Subject / Object
• Reading and Writing
• Numbers and counting
• Arithmetic
• Logic and reasoning
• Mental perspective taking
• Mental mathematics
• Playtime rewards will keep your child engaged while learning and having fun
• No Wi-Fi necessary
• No ads

MITA develops your child’s imagination and language functions. The visual exercises follow a systematic approach for developing your child's ability to notice multiple features of an object. MITA starts with simple exercises that teach your child to attend to only one feature, such as size (screenshot  #1) or color (#2). Over time, the exercises get more difficult and require your child to attend to two features simultaneously, such as both color and size (#3). Once your child has practiced attending to two features, the program moves on to puzzles that require attending to three features, such as color, size and shape (#4), and then eventually to puzzles that involve attending to an ever-increasing number of characteristics. 
The verbal exercises offer a more conventional approach to language acquisition, starting with simple vocabulary, and progressing towards higher forms of language, such as adjectives, prepositions, and syntax.
MITA is designed for early childhood and intended for long-term, daily use. It is engaging and educational, as well as adaptive and responsive to the individual abilities of each child. MITA exercises can be used by children with language delay, ASD, PDD, intellectual and developmental disability (IDD), Down syndrome, and other neurodevelopmental disorders as a supplement to conventional speech therapy.

MITA is developed by Dr. A. Vyshedskiy, a neuroscientist from Boston University; R. Dunn, a Harvard-educated early-child-development specialist; MIT-educated, J. Elgart and a group of award-winning artists and developers working alongside experienced therapists.

MITA in the news: https://youtu.be/giZymh3rMHc
MITA research articles: http://imagiration.com/research/

recentChanges:
• THE FIRST AND ONLY LANGUAGE THERAPY APPLICATION SUPPORTED BY CLINICAL DATA:
In a 3-year clinical trial of 6,454 children with autism, language score in children who engaged with MITA has increased to levels, which were 70% higher than in children with similar initial evaluations. This difference was statistically significant (p=0.0002). See results at ClinicalTrials.gov/ct2/show/results/NCT04108290.

• Adds 15 New Games.

• Activities organized into 50+ games.
comments: Very good game! Thus, for language it is important 1. To decrease delays between trials - they wre very long and a child loses attention, while in language teavhing procedure speed is a vital clue. 2. It is important before changing the "level" to verify that a word is really remembered. I have to change a level back manually at each session, because I am sure that my child does not remember a name of an object, but got the program algoryth using visual clues.
My child using it for 10 months and his improvement is really grate. Very useful app for autistic child like my son.
My 3 year loves using this app. It has definitely helped us.
It helps my 6 year old. Great app.. 👍After a few months of use, the challenge is keeping him interested as he now rejects doing this... For variety, can pictures change? Like plants? Thanks..

4 stars as a start. As the parent of a Autistic child, your "app" is challenging, easy to comprehend by the child, fast, with continuous flow of activities per letters.. THANKS, for this DEVZ. More power to you, & GOD bless you!!

title: Trisomy21
description:
We offer a free mobile application that connects
parents of children with down syndrome with
nurseries, doctors and therapists, so parents know
all the nearby services and we also provide the
tips parents need to help them deal with their children's needs properly.
We also help therapists who can't find a job or
those who need another one to increase their
income, and we help doctors who are not famous to increase the number of their patients.

title: HelpMeTalk
description:
HelpMeTalk is help to improve the Speech capabilities of people with speech and language disorders who are receiving Speech Therapy. This app is full of engaging pictures, interesting animation, voices and effective exercises. This encourages practice and results in better progress with speech.

List of features:
✔ Support multi language and voices.
✔ Support animation (GIF) beside choosing from device, you can make your own animation by taking video.
✔ Effective exercise for learn to talk with using speech recognition.
✔ Customise pictures by choosing from device or taking new photos.
✔ Customise voices by changing language setting or record your own voices.
✔ Able to adjust the vocal pitch and speech rate.

Suitable for:
• autism symptoms and Asperger syndrome, autistic spectrum disorder (ASD)
• aphasia
• speech apraxia
• articulation/phonological disorder
• Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS)
• Motor Neuron Disease (MND)
• cerebral palsy
• down syndrome

Please rate us if you like this app and share with others who need help.

comments: I like the app a lot since I'm a speech therapist my self. But there's only one downside. I made the donation and got full access, but after I record my voice when I play it back it sounds like cracking, breaking.... it's not a good recording feature. Also, the app keeps crashing and stopping out of the blue. Does it has unresolved bugs? Please, I want my contribution to matter. Thanks

Most stupid app ever seen. This app doesn't deserve one star. Its a waste of time and data. After downloading 47mb, it still want me to connect to internet before it works. Even with the internet connection it keeps saying cannot connect to the server.

Nice app. Paid the subscription for the full version and found it easy enough to record audio and pictures. Big issue though is that it needs internet access to open the app. Big turn off not being able to use the app at all in offline mode. If this was fixed would consider reinstalling and updating the score.

This helps my son learn to say words by attaching a picture and hearing it say that word. I had trouble getting it to work at first, but after contacting the developer, they helped me fix that problem. Thanks!
Since I've shown my son this app, he opens the app and goes through the menu and attempts repeats the words by himself, without me having to sit and practice with him. Really easy for him to use.

title: Salud Down UC
description:
El acompañamiento en salud de los niños y jóvenes con síndrome de Down y de los que están por nacer es un gran desafío. Salud Down busca orientar a los padres y profesionales sobre los cuidados en salud y las recomendaciones del desarrollo de las personas con síndrome de Down, quienes requieren de algunas recomendaciones especiales con el objetivo de lograr una mejor calidad de vida y expresar al máximo su potencial de desarrollo.

El contenido de Salud Down ha sido desarrollado por el equipo pediátrico del Centro UC síndrome de Down, considerando las recomendaciones actuales nacionales e internacionales disponibles a la fecha.

Dentro de las funciones de esta aplicación, podrá encontrar lo siguiente:

- Inicio y registro: Podrá registrar y personalizar la aplicación con los datos de su hijo o hija.
- Mi ficha clínica: Ficha para referencia rápida que podrá completar con información médica importante
- Información escrita para lectura
a.     Qué es el síndrome de Down
b.     Cuidados de Salud Generales
              	              	Cuidados del Recién Nacido
              	              	Lactancia Materna
              	              	Alimentación
              	              	Cuidados de Salud Dental
              	              	Prevención de Accidentes
              	              	Estimulación Temprana
              	              	Educación Sexual y Afectividad
c.     Problemas de Salud más Frecuentes
- Recomendaciones de salud según edad
a.     Información general
b.     Cuidados Médicos
c.     Exámenes
d.     Medicamentos
e.     Vacunas
f.      Estimulación y Desarrollo
g.     Alimentación
- Calendario para ingresar nuevos controles con pediatra o especialista. Los controles quedarán guardados en una carpeta, para fácil acceso posterior
- Curvas de crecimiento: Podrá visualizar los datos ingresados en los controles médicos graficados en las curvas de crecimiento recomendadas para usar en población de niños y adolescentes con síndrome de Down.
- Calendario de inmunizaciones: Podrá completar las vacunas administradas a su hijo o hija (este calendario ha sido desarrollado considerando el calendario de inmunización Chileno).


Esperamos que esta aplicación sea de utilidad y que la disfruten.

Contacto: 
centroucdown@uc.cl 
www.centroucdown.uc.cl

title: Health Swap
description: Health Swap is a new healthy living app that makes living a healthier lifestyle easier. The App allows people with Down's syndrome and their carers to improve their quality of living through healthier eating and activity tracking, whilst also improving their digital skills and capabilities.
descriptionHTML: Health Swap is a new healthy living app that makes living a healthier lifestyle easier. The App allows people with Down's syndrome and their carers to improve their quality of living through healthier eating and activity tracking, whilst also improving their digital skills and capabilities.
summary: Health Swap is a new healthy living app

comments: Just downloaded and had a quick look through. It's so simple to use. The planner, shopping and cooking guide look great. Can't wait to get my daughter started.
Fantastic application. Really speedy functions and big colourful buttons.
Simple to use and really useful
Great app!

title: AR - Sindrome de Down
description:
El Centro Regional de Formación Docente e Investigación Educativa, Sur-Sureste presenta esta guía electrónica de uso online mediante web y uso offline que incorpora la realidad aumentada,videos, galerías de imágenes y podcasts para estimular el interés del lector.

 El Síndrome de Down es una alteración genética que se conoce también como trisomía 21, donde distintos órganos y sistemas son afectados en su funcionamiento, pero de manera diferente en cada individuo.  

 Esta guía está compuesta de varios apartados:

 -       ¿Qué es el síndrome de Down?
-       Características 
-       Testimonios de éxito
-       Videos
-       Problemas asociados 
-       Recursos de realidad aumentada
-       Interacción familia, escuela y aula.
-       Estrategias de evaluación
-       Recursos de intervención
-       Sitios de Interés
-       Glosario de términos 

 A través de los recursos se aborda el tema de manera sencilla y útil; y se obtiene información adecuada y fiable sobre el tema.

El Síndrome de Down es una alteración genética que se conoce también como trisomía 21, donde distintos órganos y sistemas son afectados en su funcionamiento, pero de manera diferente en cada individuo.

Esta guía está compuesta de varios apartados:

- ¿Qué es el síndrome de Down?
- Características
- Testimonios de éxito
- Videos
- Problemas asociados
- Recursos de realidad aumentada
- Interacción familia, escuela y aula.
- Estrategias de evaluación
- Recursos de intervención
- Sitios de Interés
- Glosario de términos

A través de los recursos se aborda el tema de manera sencilla y útil; y se obtiene información adecuada y fiable sobre el tema.
summary: This guide integrates RA, videos, podcasts and images of interest to the reader.

title: EasyKidTokens
description:
This token board is a teaching tool for behavior development and modification commonly used in ABA. Great for young children as well as kids on the autistic spectrum, asperger's, PDD NOS, Down syndrome or other kinds of developmental delay.

Customize it with your own pictures and descriptions of rewards. Just hit "Add" at the top of the list of pictures. You can take a picture with your phone, or add a picture from Gallery.

Please email the developer with your feedback. I’d love to hear from you!
descriptionHTML:
This token board is a teaching tool for behavior development and modification commonly used in ABA. Great for young children as well as kids on the autistic spectrum, asperger's, PDD NOS, Down syndrome or other kinds of developmental delay.

Customize it with your own pictures and descriptions of rewards. Just hit "Add" at the top of the list of pictures. You can take a picture with your phone, or add a picture from Gallery.

Please email the developer with your feedback. I’d love to hear from you!
summary: Help your kid focus, engage and learn with a colorful token board.
recentChanges: The app is back by popular demand. Thank you for your support!
comments: I love this app but cannot figure out how to get the Halloween and Christmas tokens. It just sends me on a giant circle.
I use this for work. It's very simple and easy to use. I love it. Thank you for bringing it back. 😁😁😁

I have been using this simple token system since it's beginning. The kids and I love it's ease of use and colorful pictures. So convenient to have on my phone. Other Behavior Interventionists are always asking me where I got it! Thank you!!
Love this app but wish it included the ability to make more than one sticker chart. However my kids love it. It is bright and easy to use.
I contacted support and never got a response, I use this for my work and when it crashes I can't get any help.

title: My GiGi's
description:
The My GiGi's app provides easy access to all of the exciting news and events at GiGi's Playhouse - Down Syndrome Achievement Centers.  You can easily see the latest blog posts from both your local playhouse and the national office, the local playhouse calendar, events you've registered to attend, social media feeds, and more - all in one place.  You must have a valid email account registered at GiGi's Playhouse to use the app.  If you are new to the GiGi's community, reach out to your local Playhouse for more information or sign up for our newsletter.  More information can be found at https://gigisplayhouse.org

GiGi's Playhouse provides free purposeful programs to the Down syndrome community at brick and mortar locations and spread the Generation G message of global acceptance for all.

Our Mission and Purpose:  To change the way the world views Down syndrome and to send a global message of acceptance for all.

Our Vision:  To see a world where individuals with Down syndrome are accepted and embraced in their families, schools and communities.

Our Niche:  We change lives through consistent delivery of free educational, therapeutic-based and career development programs for individuals with Down syndrome, their families and the community, through a replicable playhouse model.

Our Promise:  A lifetime commitment to families.

title: LetMeTalk: Free AAC Talker
description:
A free AAC talker app which supports communication in all areas of life and therefore providing a voice to everyone. LetMeTalk is donation financed.

LetMeTalk enables you to line up images in a meaningful way to read this row of images as a sentence. To line up images is known as AAC (Augmentative and Alternative Communication).

Problems to Install? Find solution at bit.ly/1p6zGW8

The image database of LetMeTalk contains more than 9,000 easy to understand images from ARASAAC (http://arasaac.org). Additionally, you can add existing images from the device or take new photos with the build in camera.

To use LetMeTalk, no internet connection or mobile contract is necessary. Therefore you can use LetMeTalk in almost any situation, like hospitals, nursing home or schools.

You can find LetMeTalk tutorials at http://letmetalk.info/support

Suitable for:
• autism symptoms and Asperger syndrome, autistic spectrum disorder (ASD)
• aphasia
• speech apraxia
• articulation/phonological disorder
• Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS)
• Motor Neuron Disease (MND)
• cerebral palsy
• down syndrome

Features:
✔ more than 9,000 images from ARASAAC included
✔ Used by Speech Language Pathologists (SLP)
✔ voice support for images and sentences
✔ unlimited creation of new categories and adding new images
✔ pre configured for kids with autism spectrum disorder (ASD)
✔ load / save your current profile (vocabulary)
✔ keep several profiles on your devices and switch fast between them
✔ share your profile easily with other devices
✔ load new profiles from our forum directly within LetMeTalk
✔ switch fast between 2 languages and use LetMeTalk as translator

✔ supported languages: English, Spanish, French, Italian and German, Chinese, Portuguese, Brazilian Portuguese, Arabic, Russian, Polish, Bulgarian, Romanian, Galician, Catalan, Basque
✔ voice, if used language is supported by installed text to speech engine

Download now!

comments: It's a great app. with core vocabulary! You can form sentences, edit/customize pages and pictures, add pages and pictures, and it's super easy to navigate! Anddd it's free!! I highly recommend this app!!

I'm too old to figure this out.... Need something that lets me use the keyboard to type and then read that out loud. Maybe have a library of phrase I've input.... Communication outside of my computer is too tedious no matter what.

This app has been a life-saver; we use it to support our communications with our child on the autistic spectrum. The app in itself has to be personalized, and it is NOT easy.. It is time-consuming to get the personalized images (although they have an extensive generic image bank) up, as well as the pronunciation you wish on specific names or words. And, it is nearly impossible to transfer a profile between android devices. Yes, the app could be better, and it is a shame there is no more technical support offered for it, but I am giving it five stars because it is free, and it has been a massive help to us. Thanks!

I found this yesterday and have been playing around with it-I have 18 years experience working for children who have execptionalities. This is a wonderful app for anybody who may need a voice at times but do not have professional supports in place yet. My son has found it easy to navigate and loves that I was able to personalize the labels. The only issue I've had so far pertains to rearranging the pictures, they didn't stay where I put them.

Trying numerous augmented communication apps for my daughter and this one was the closest to what she use to have on the ipad when the device died. Awesome app. Very easy to set up, a lot of setting options to customize for the needs of the individual and it does not matter how long she pushes the button, it will say the word. Speech can be a little odd but this app gives you the ability to use other voice apps to change the sound. After trying quite a few, this is the one which fit all my needs. Will be donating money to the developer as soon as I can. Great job and thank you so very much!

title: Yo también leo | Aprender a leer con Método Global
description:
“Yo también leo” es la aplicación ideal para que niños y niñas de 3 a 6 años o niños y niñas de 4 a 12 años con síndrome de Down, autismo u otros tipos de discapacidad intelectual aprendan a leer.

Está basada en el método global de lectura y se ha diseñado para adaptarse a las necesidades de los niños y niñas con discapacidad cognitiva o retraso madurativo con el fin de potenciar sus capacidades. 

La aplicación es de descarga gratuita y tiene la posibilidad de compras integradas dentro de la app para desarrollar el método global de lectura completo.

VENTAJAS
Esta app para aprender a leer facilita el aprendizaje intuitivo a través del juego.

“Yo también leo” ha sido supervisada por pedagogas, logopedas y maestras especializadas en pedagogía terapéutica.  
Trabajando con la aplicación el niño o niña:

 ✔️️ Aprende a leer
 ✔️️ Fomenta su autonomía
 ✔️️ Aumenta su motivación
 ✔️️ Potencia sus capacidades
 ✔️️ Mejora el lenguaje


MÉTODO GLOBAL o ANALÍTICO
La aplicación está basada en el método de lectura global. 
Este método se basa en la percepción global de la palabra acompañada de una imagen que muestra su significado. Como el método Troncoso, parte de las unidades mayores, frases y palabras completas, asociadas a un concepto visual y continúa con la decodificación de éstas en unidades más pequeñas como las sílabas y finalmente las letras. 

Los niños y niñas con síndrome de Down, autismo u otros tipos de discapacidad intelectual, no entienden los conceptos abstractos, como las letras y/o las sílabas. Por este motivo y por su facilidad de percepción visual, el método de lectura global es perfecto para ellos.


Es un método natural que facilita la comprensión lectora desde el principio, por este motivo, igual que el método de lectura precoz de Glenn Doman es ideal para niños y niñas menores de 6 años y para niños con dificultades cognitivas.



LA APLICACIÓN
La aplicación dispone de:
- 3 tipos de letra a elegir (Mayúsculas, imprenta y ligada)
- 3 imágenes distintas para cada palabra (fotografías y dibujos)
- Ayuda visual para facilitar la dinámica de las actividades
- Refuerzo positivo en todas las actividades
- Opción de trabajar las palabras con o sin artículo
- Opción de repetir el mismo ejercicio hasta 6 veces si el niño o niña lo desea.
- Opción de incluir palabras propias (con la compra de uno de los niveles)

Con la DESCARGA GRATUITA trabajarás con:
- 20 palabras
- 1 nivel de dificultad con 3 actividades que permiten trabajar ejercicios de prelectura y memorización: Juegos de parejas, bits de memoria y puzzles.
También tendrás 3 juegos de recompensa.
Duración del juego ilimitada.

Desde la misma aplicación podrás acceder mediante compras integradas a la aplicación completa.

COMPRAS INTEGRADAS para acceder a la versión completa:
Niveles 1, 2 o 3 que incluyen 70 palabras de vocabulario básico más la opción de incluir palabras propias personalizando imagen, texto y audio.
Paquetes de vocabulario específico.


CARACTERÍSTICAS 
Para que el uso de la aplicación sea más efectivo, es recomendable instalarla en una tablet o dispositivo de 7 pulgadas o superior. 


La aplicación se adapta a los distintos idiomas teniendo en cuenta las particularidades de cada uno. 
Disponible en español y catalán.


Esta aplicación está validada por profesionales y entidades especializadas

Toda la información que necesites la encontrarás en nuestra web
👉yotambienleo.com

title: KinScreen 🥇 Most advanced screen control
description:
Do you find yourself poking your screen to keep it from turning off? Want to turn your screen on without the power button? KinScreen automatically keeps your screen on while you're using your phone, but turns it off more quickly when you aren't to save battery power.
 
Please check www.dontkillmyapp.com to make sure KinScreen is able to run in the background!
Works on Android 10!
 
Brief overview
• Turn screen on with a wave
• Turn screen off with a short timeout when in pocket or face down
• Keep screen on just by holding device
• Keep screen on while using certain apps
• Keep screen on while charging
• Keep screen on while on a call
• Keep screen on indefinitely with widget, QuickSettings, or notification toggle
• Set a separate timeout for the lock screen
• Set a maximum time to keep the screen on
• Works in the dark unlike Samsung's Smart Stay
• No ads
 
Install now and forget about keeping your screen on! Once you feel the benefits, you will immediately notice it missing on a new device!
Customer service is a top priority at TEQTIC. If you experience an issue, please use the "Contact support" menu option inside the app or email contact@teqtic.com before leaving a negative review! We usually reply to all emails within 48 hours, and often much quicker.
 
Detailed overview
Turn screen on with gestures
Save the wear and tear on your power button when you turn the screen on by uncovering or waving over the proximity sensor. Uncovering the sensor allows you to pull your phone out of your pocket and have the screen turn on automatically. Waving over the sensor works great when your hands are dirty!
 
Keep screen on automatically
Choose from various methods to detect use of the device and keep the display on. The motion method detects small movements from you just holding the device. Waving over the proximity sensor is another method that optionally extends the timeout. The tilt angle method allows the display to stay on when propped up, even when you aren't holding it. You can also choose to have the display stay on while using certain apps, while charging, or while on a call (display still turns off when you put the phone to your ear).
 
Time screen out quickly to save battery
You can choose the screen timeout when no keep-on rules are actively keeping the screen on. If the screen isn't being kept on, it should time out quickly to save power. The timeout can be even shorter when the proximity sensor is covered (in-pocket or face down). You can also set a separate timeout for the lockscreen.
 
More information
The settings are highly customizable to your taste. Fine-tuning of parameters is locked in the free version. Please upgrade to premium to fully unlock these features and support future development! KinScreen is continually being improved based on user feedback and feature requests.
  
KinScreen is designed to be as efficient and battery friendly as possible. It uses little CPU and RAM, and sensor use is highly optimized. However, the proximity sensor may use considerable power on some devices.
 
KinScreen will not interfere with any other apps that already keep the screen on since it never actively turns it off.
 
The status bar icon changes based on if KinScreen is keeping the screen on, timing out, or timing out more quickly due to proximity. Inside the app, the colored statuses at the top give you even more insight into what KinScreen is doing. A green status is keeping the screen on, a red status is timing the screen out, and a yellow status would be keeping the screen on but there is another rule preventing it.
 
To calibrate motion sensitivity, please set the device on a very stable surface, tap calibrate and wait 10 seconds for KinScreen to automatically fine tune the motion sensitivity for your device.

comments: I have a Samsung Note 8, and its screen settings limit 10 minutes of inactivity maximum. That makes it difficult and frustrating when I'm gaming with an emulator and gamepad. Kinscreen is fantastic because it will leave my screen on all day while I'm gaming or just dont want to constantly unlock it with my password. Settings allow for it to not turn off in certain situations or use a manual toggle to just stay on all day. It also shows the angle the phone is at with a motion sensor. Excellent!

It's perfect for my wallet case: closed - screen off, open - screen on, with great control settings. I'd used another app for years, but lost a few features when I recently upgraded my phone. After using KinScreen for about a week, it's done everything I was hoping it would. I just tweaked a couple of settings (after realizing how I wanted it to work) and I'm very impressed. Thanks, guys!

Update: I did follow the advice of TEQTIC and it is working like a charm now. Thanks! I've tried many similar apps but Kinscreen beats them all. The only problem I'm experiencing now is that randomly the app stops working. The app is 'on' but doesn't what it is supposed to do and the icon in the notification bar is gone. Once I open the app it works fine for 1 or 2 days. This is since a day or 5. Could it have something to do with Android 10 which I downloaded a week ago? Something in settings?

I love KinScreen. On my Moto Z it works great. On my Moto G8 it won't let me set the screen display time in settings. It keeps changing it to 10 seconds. Both phones have the same KinScreen settings. I don't want the display turning off that fast. Teqtic do you know what's up?

Perfect replacement for old Screebl app ehich is no longer supported and no longer working on new devices. All that I needed is covered by this app and after writing to dev team with new suggestions they seem open to new ideas which is refreshing. Worth every penny so far.

title: Hit & Knock down
description:
When you hit the target with a ball, the target knocks down or explodes.
Achieve the stage score to clear then challenge the next level.

[Game modes]
- Ball limit mode: Hit the can, Break dishes, Score target, Hit the fruit 
- Time limit mode: Hit the folder target, Shoot the parachute, Hit the oil drums, Hit the roly-poly toy

[Features]
- Enjoy the various game modes with simple control.
- Various balls supported (baseball ball, bowling bowl, volleyball, soccer ball, billiard ball)
- Challenge mode: the road to the world best record.
- Offline mode supported.
- Multiplayer mode supported.
- 16 languages supported.
- Achievement & leaderboard supported.

title: Secure Autonomy
description:
Secure Autonomy is an application that helps young people and adults with Down syndrome and other intellectual disability to move autonomously and independently while his family remains quiet.

Its main function is to automate the monitoring of the child, ensuring that it reaches its activities independently and safely. The Parent application will receive an alert if something is wrong. It also shows on the map the last known location of your child.

Secure Autonomy is an application that helps young people and adults with Down syndrome and other intellectual disability to move autonomously and independently while his family remains quiet.

Its main function is to automate the monitoring of the child, ensuring that it reaches its activities independently and safely. The Parent application will receive an alert if something is wrong. It also shows on the map the last known location of your child.
summary: Monitors an Android device. Program alerts and get last position.
recentChanges: Now the application is more secure and compatible with Android 9 (Pie).

title: Teach Your Kids To Read
description:
Teach Your Kids To Read is a useful tool for those who are applying the method for early reading, created by Glenn Doman, but also for those who simply want to share the reading of new words with the children.

You'll let your child see some virtual flashcards, following the steps of the same method. For a complete and official description and application of the method refer to the Glenn Doman's book "Teach your Baby to Read".

Learning to read English will be easy and fun. Something to do with your child that will help him grows and discovers new things. Teaching how to read is the best way to start the child to a deeper and faster education.
Improve your children QI!

Read from an early age also improves verbal and relationship skills. Reading is like learning to speak.

The Alphabet (ABC) is available in uppercase and lowercase.

You can teach the words already contained in the app or add new ones to create the first book to read with your child.

Once your child will be able to read the English words, you can use the same app to let him learn how to read another language (Spanish, English, French) by adding new words and modifying the existing ones.

The best app available for reading!

Mummy, Daddy
One by one, you'll teach the first two words: mummy and daddy. The red color support to recognize the words. Clicking on the microphone icon it will be possible to record the pronunciation of the word using your own voice. The audio will be played when the word is shown or touching the screen.

Me - Around Me
You'll teach the words belonging to the child himself/herself and the ones of the environment around him/her. The size of the font is barely smaller. You're able to add new words and delete old ones. It's also possible to record the pronunciation of the word using your own voice.

My First Book
You'll be able to add and see single pages of the book that will be completed in the next step.

A Real Book
Starting on the pages created in the previous step, you'll see the pages of the book in a smaller size. Now the kid can try t read the whole page which is composed by every sentence taught separately in the last step.

Alphabet
You'll show the alphabet in capital and lower case letters.

Quick Word
A rapid way to write a word and let the child read. From the main menu you can decide the color of the word (red/black).

title: Constant Therapy
description:
Constant Therapy is an award-winning speech therapy app designed to help people cope with aphasia, dementia and other speech, language and cognitive disorders caused by stroke or traumatic brain injuries. To date, thousands of users have completed over 110 million exercises using Constant Therapy. 

BENEFITS

•        Practice speech, language, cognition, memory, reading, attention and comprehension skills anytime, anywhere
•        Choose your recovery goals and we’ll deliver personalized tasks to help you get there
•        See your progress in real time on your performance dashboard
•        Access a library of evidence-based exercises developed by neuroscientists and clinicians 
•        Get the most out of Constant Therapy with one-on-one help from Customer Support specialists 
•        Try before you subscribe with a 2-week free trial
•        Pair the app with cognitive and speech therapy you’re already doing in the clinic (even add your clinician so they can monitor your progress)


The Science Behind Constant Therapy:

Constant Therapy was designed by scientists at Boston University, and has won awards from the American Stroke Association and AARP. The clinically-proven app is recommended by speech language pathologists, neurologists and occupational therapists.

In a recent study of post-stroke rehabilitation practices published in Frontiers in Neurology, outcomes were compared among 3,686 patients who used tablet-based therapy at home independently and those who completed the same therapy in a clinic under the guidance of a clinician. The study found tablet-based home users mastered skills in a shorter time and practiced therapy more frequently than clinic users. Nearly one third (29%) of users who made gains were 71 years old or more, and the oldest user was 97 years old.*

Using Constant Therapy

- Try before you subscribe with a free 14-day trial

- Users can choose from two subscription plans: $24.99 per month or $249.99 per year.

Contact Us

Email – support@constanttherapy.com

Visit Online – https://thelearningcorp.com/constant-therapy/

Privacy Policy – https://thelearningcorp.com/privacy/

Terms of Use – https://thelearningcorp.com/eula/


* Study published in Frontiers in Neurology, “Comparison of Therapy Practice at Home and in the Clinic: A Retrospective Analysis of the Constant Therapy Platform Data Set,” may be found at: https://www.frontiersin.org/articles/10.3389/fneur.2019.00140/full

** Constant Therapy does not provide rehabilitation services and does not guarantee improvements in brain function. Constant Therapy provides tools for self-help and tools for patients to work with their clinicians

recentChanges: More streamlined therapy experience, several bug fixes and performance improvements.
comments: Problems for people with dimentia or Alzheimers... It is NOT appropriate to ask them how well they are remembering things, understanding things, etc.as this app does with the user. Do not do that! It's embarrasing and very upsetting to people with those conditions to be asked those questions. If someone is using it with them, that person can answer those questions for them if it can be done without their hearing or seeing the questions. It is a good idea for someoneto do the exercises with them.

Went thru the baseline activities. Then was asked if I wanted to subscribe. Since I had no info on what subscription would entitle me to, plus no idea how much it would cost, I chose subscribe. But the page wouldn't load. Waited about 3 mins then X'd out of the app. I believe the app could help me, but I'm most likely out of the game because I'm on a very tight fixed income (disability).

great idea. not edited properly. I have went through multiple questions and there are multiple correct answers, however if you do not guess the CT APP correct answer your answer is deamed wrong. Even simple ones where you have to identify the symbols. There were 5 symbols, but it only lets you mark 4 of them. Good idea, poor follow through. Or you have to say the name of the picture, the picture is of a persons legs at a beach. If you say beach it us wrong because they are looking for LEG.

I have been looking for an app like this for a few years. Paid $2000 out of pocket to get all my strengths and weakness after multiple TBI's. After you register, you find out, you can only use it for15 days, then have to get a note from a doctor to use it, and pay them. I don' t mind paying for an app to help me. Getting a doctor note, when you are on a fixed income, w/o insurance is what I object to. If I ready needed a doctor I get a nice cash only based rate, but this is not neccessary.

Was excited to find something to improve my cognitive abilities, then I read the "about game" and found the app is free for 15 days, then you have to pay $25 a month, or $250 a year, or $350 for 2 years!!! I have been out of work since having a stroke (4 months). I can't afford $25 a month when I'm struggling to pay my electric bill, have already terminated the TV, phone is next to cut. App is free only for therapists and those working in the medical field. DON'T INSTALL. WASTE OF TIME.

Knock Down Bottles by hitting them with amazing balls.

title: Button Mapper: Remap your keys
description:
Button Mapper makes it easy to remap custom actions to your volume buttons and other hardware buttons. Remap buttons to launch any app, shortcut or custom action with a single, double press or long press.

Button Mapper can remap most physical or capacitive keys and buttons, such as volume buttons, some assist buttons, and capacitive home, back and recent apps keys. Button Mapper can also remap buttons on many gamepads, remotes and other peripheral devices.

Root is not required for most actions, however some require an adb command from a connected PC if not rooted. Button Mapper does not work when the screen is off unless your device is rooted or you run an adb command.

A few examples of remapping you can do with Button Mapper:
-long press to toggle your flashlight
-remap your TV remote control
-press to broadcast custom intents, scripts or commands
-long press to open camera and take a photo
-double tap to launch your favorite app or shortcut
-double tap to open your notifications
-swap your back and recent apps keys (capacitive buttons only!)
-use your volume buttons to adjust screen brightness
-long press to toggle "do not disturb" mode
-and much more

Additional features unlocked in the pro version: 
-Simulate keycodes (requires adb command or root)
-Swap volume keys on orientation change
-Default to ring volume on Pie or later
-Pocket detection
-Themes
-Change back and recents buttons
-Customization of haptic feedback (vibration) on button press and long press

Actions that can be mapped to buttons or keys:
-Launch any app or shortcut
-Disable the button
-Broadcast intents (PRO)
-Run scripts (PRO)
-Camera shutter
-Turn screen off
-Toggle flashlight
-Quick settings
-Show notifications
-Power dialog
-Take screenshot
-Music: previous/next track and play/pause
-Adjust volume or mute
-Last app switch
-Toggle do not disturb
-Adjust brightness
-Now on tap (root)
-Menu button (root)
-Choose custom keycode (root and PRO)
-Root command (root and PRO)
-Toggle WiFi
-Toggle Bluetooth
-Toggle rotation
-Clear notifications
-Split screen
-Scroll up/down (root)
-And many more...

Buttons supported:
-Physical home, back and recent apps/menu buttons
-Volume up
-Volume down
-Most camera buttons
-Many headset buttons
-Custom buttons: add other buttons (active, mute, etc) on your phone, headphones, gamepads, TV remote and other peripheral devices

Additional options:
-change the long press or double tap duration
-delay initial button press for better double tap operation
-disable Button Mapper while using specific apps
-plus many more customizations

Troubleshooting:
-Make sure Button Mapper accessibility service is enabled and allowed to run in the background
-Button Mapper does not work with onscreen buttons (such as soft keys or the navigation bar) or the power button. 
-The options shown in the app depend on the buttons available on your phone. Not all phones have home, back and recents buttons!

This app uses Accessibility services. Accessibility is used to detect when the physical or capacitive buttons are pressed on your device so they can be remapped to custom actions to accommodate your needs. It is not used to see what you type. Button Mapper does not collect or share any of your personal information, it is safe and your privacy is respected.

This app uses the Device Administrator permission. (BIND_DEVICE_ADMIN)
This permission is used to lock the screen if the "Turn screen off" action is chosen. If you want to remove this permission, open Button Mapper, click on the menu (three dots in the upper right corner) and select "Uninstall"
descriptionHTML:
Button Mapper makes it easy to remap custom actions to your volume buttons and other hardware buttons. Remap buttons to launch any app, shortcut or custom action with a single, double press or long press.

Button Mapper can remap most physical or capacitive keys and buttons, such as volume buttons, some assist buttons, and capacitive home, back and recent apps keys. Button Mapper can also remap buttons on many gamepads, remotes and other peripheral devices.

Root is not required for most actions, however some require an adb command from a connected PC if not rooted. Button Mapper does not work when the screen is off unless your device is rooted or you run an adb command.

A few examples of remapping you can do with Button Mapper:
-long press to toggle your flashlight
-remap your TV remote control
-press to broadcast custom intents, scripts or commands
-long press to open camera and take a photo
-double tap to launch your favorite app or shortcut
-double tap to open your notifications
-swap your back and recent apps keys (capacitive buttons only!)
-use your volume buttons to adjust screen brightness
-long press to toggle "do not disturb" mode
-and much more

Additional features unlocked in the pro version:
-Simulate keycodes (requires adb command or root)
-Swap volume keys on orientation change
-Default to ring volume on Pie or later
-Pocket detection
-Themes
-Change back and recents buttons
-Customization of haptic feedback (vibration) on button press and long press

Actions that can be mapped to buttons or keys:
-Launch any app or shortcut
-Disable the button
-Broadcast intents (PRO)
-Run scripts (PRO)
-Camera shutter
-Turn screen off
-Toggle flashlight
-Quick settings
-Show notifications
-Power dialog
-Take screenshot
-Music: previous/next track and play/pause
-Adjust volume or mute
-Last app switch

comments: This app is AWESOME! That's coming from a software engineer. Usability and functionality are top notch. It can even turn off my stupid glowing hardware buttons, which is a must. I don't understand complaining about the $5 premium upgrade which allows you to modify the back and home buttons (precisely why I downloaded the app). How dare someone try to get paid for their hard work? 😒 You probably spend more on a single coffee. That said, I wasn't expecting it going in, and that may be the issue.

Okay, I almost NEVER rate apps, but this one actually worked! It was a bit of a pain to hook it up to a PC and connect, debug, etc, but no other app actually disabled that annoying Bixby button. All others let it pop up over other screens, then you could close it, this one kills the button. DEAD! Exactly what I was looking for as every time I mounted the phone in a gimbal, selfie stick, tripod holder, ETC.that frickin Bixby would pop up and start yakking. Now she's SHUT UP for good! LOL.

It actually works. This app does what it says. This made my water damaged Samsung A5 usable again!! After my phone got wet the back button constantly triggered. With this program I turned off the regular press of the back button and re-mapped the "long press" and I can use my phone almost exactly as before. I happily paid the for the app. A few $100 saved overall...!

Works great to remap the keys of the new Google TV Chromecast Remote Control. The Youtube and Netflix button can now easily be mapped to different applications and with the single, double and long press options, you can map 3 options (including Youtube and Netflix) to those 2 buttons. Great app. Took 1 minute to figure it out.

very cool app! works great on my Philips TV to remap the Rakuten key to Disney and YouTube (long press) can't get the broadcast intent to work to switch to HDMI 1 when I press the TV key though :-( I know the correct adb command, but it won't work... the %2F is translated to / in the Button Mapper interface adb shell am start -a android.intent.action.VIEW -d content://android.media.tv/passthrough/com.mediatek.tvinput%2F.hdmi.HDMIInputService%2FHW5

title: uTalk - Learn Any Language
description:
Learn languages fast: uTalk gets results because every word you hear is in your new language and you speak, listen and understand from Day One.

The app has a huge range of 140+ languages and with free starter words in each, you can try it risk-free. Score full marks in the games and you can also unlock an extra topic in your language for free.


uTalk helps you speak a new language for these 3 reasons:

1. Learn from the locals: We record native speakers so you can hear every word pronounced clearly.  We then get you to mimic their pronunciation and compare your intonation with theirs. Practise until you get it right – you can even slow the audio down if it’s too fast.

2. Crammed full of words: Useful everyday words and phrases. Topics, like Food and Drink, take around two to three hours to complete. But you can dip in for just five minutes at a time or longer. With 60+ topics, that’s a total of 180 hours of learning.  

3. Keeps you motivated: Check your scores on progress bars as you move through five progressively difficult games. To get full marks, you’ll have to know the words as well as your own language.

Who’s it for? uTalk’s tried and trusted way to learn a new language has been developed over 25 years and is perfect for beginners. But, because of its wide-ranging language, it’s also invaluable for intermediates looking to fill in gaps in their vocabulary and pronunciation.

How it works: Subscribe to everything on uTalk or buy individual languages or topics. Learn on any device, at home or on the move. The app automatically syncs between your devices. Work offline by downloading content. 


Find your language:

Afrikaans, Albanian, Amharic, Arabic (Egyptian, Gulf, Lebanese, Modern Standard, Moroccan), Armenian, Assamese, Azerbaijani

Any questions? support@utalk.com

title: Kids Educational Games. Attention
description:
Kids Play Visual Games is an app that consists of 15 educational games developed to reinforce skills of visual and spatial perception, aimed at kids of all ages.
Each of these games will help your child to process information and implement visual skills through fun eye exercises, accompanied by our raccoon pet and its animal friends, which will compliment and encourage kids every time they solve the game.

VISUAL ACUITY EDUCATIONAL GAMES 
This visual stimulation at an early age acts as a reinforcement to help their cognitive development and prevent possible attention and concentration problems. Babies and children will learn to:

- Identify shapes and colors.
- Process spatial relation: orientation, size and position.
- Associate silhouettes and elements.
- Improve visual acuity searching objects.
- Develop manual dexterity and motor skills.
- Detect and classify intruders within a list of elements.
- Differentiate figures and backgrounds.
- Enhance their attention span and concentration.
- Boost observation skills and difference perception.

Kids Play Visual Games are carefully designed with a simple interface in order to make children have fun while learning with animals and kid-friendly characters.

DIFFERENT DIFFICULTY LEVELS
Our goal is that, whatever the intellectual capacity of the child may be, they can sharpen their visual acuity gradually. To do that, the game offers three difficulty levels (easy, medium and difficult), adapted to different ages and stages of development.

Easy: Ideal for beginners, especially for babies and kids at an early age.
Medium: Perfect for those children who are already familiar with the game.
Difficult: Suitable for kids who have managed to solve each game quickly and don’t need supervision of parents or teachers to solve them.

EDUJOY EDUCATIONAL GAMES 
This app is part of an educational games collection created by Edujoy in order to help kids to develop new intellectual and motor skills from elements of their environment.

All our games are created by professional educators and psychologists in order to provide pedagogical content, necessary for the intellectual development of babies and children.

We love creating educational and fun games for you. If you have any suggestions or questions, feel free to send us your feedback or leave your comments.

title: My First Words: Baby learning apps for infants
description:
Are you looking for baby apps for 1 year olds for baby early education? This baby learning app is designed for 1 years old toddlers to teach common everyday words. If you baby is 1 to 2 year olds than this baby learning game is for you. Toddlers like toddler learning games and this one will be their favorite toddler game for free. Kids can play baby learning games offline and no wifi needed.

- Colorful high quality pictures keep your babies' interest level high.
- There are 6 baby flash card categories (At home, Food, Animals, Toys, Nature and On-Wheels).
- Professional pronunciation of words for kid's correct learning.
- Baby first words has one of the best and intuitive navigation in all toddler learning games.
- Baby flash cards can keep your kids entertained anywhere, anytime!
- Very nice baby songs play and baby laughs when baby image is touched in baby learning games!
- Educative flashcards for toddlers and baby flash cards.
- No wifi needed and you can play offline baby learning apps.

Short on time and want results fast?  Get fit with a different total body workout every day with 7 Minute Workout.

BEGINNER FRIENDLY

BUILD THE WORKOUT YOU WANT

title: Breathe, Think, Do with Sesame
description:
Laugh and learn as you help a Sesame Street monster friend calm down and solve everyday challenges. This bilingual (English and Spanish), research-based app helps your child learn Sesame’s “Breathe, Think, Do” strategy for problem-solving. Tap and touch to help the monster friend take deep breaths, think of plans, and try them out! Your child will enjoy silly animations and playful interactions as she is exposed to important emotional vocabulary, a calm breathing technique, personalized encouragements, and more!

Features:
• Explore five interactive activities with a unique, everyday challenge
• Tap, pop bubbles, and more to help the monster breathe, think, and do to solve problems and feel better
• Personalize encouraging phrases that your child will hear as they help the monster think of a plan*
• ”Breathe with the Monster” activity to help children practice taking deep breaths to calm down 
• Robust Parent Section with great resources for navigating everyday challenges with your young child

*We’re sorry, but if you’re using any device without a built in microphone, this feature will not be supported.

Breathe, Think, Do with Sesame is intended for parents and caregivers to use with their young children (ages 2-5).

PLEASE NOTE: Breathe, Think, Do with Sesame is a very robust app and requires a strong wifi connection to ensure a complete download process.
• If you’re having download issues, please ensure you have a strong wifi connection and try rebooting your device. If the download does not resume, delete the app or end the download process and start again.
• If you’re having installation issues or the app is stuck on the loading screen, delete the app and reinstall while connected to a strong wifi signal.
• If you continue to have trouble, we encourage you to reach out to us. We want to ensure our tools are working and your family has an opportunity to enjoy Breathe, Think, Do with Sesame.

Curriculum:
This app aims to teach Sesame’s “Breathe, Think, Do” strategy for problem-solving. The app is part of Sesame Street’s Little Children, Big Challenges initiative, which aims to provide tools to help children build skills for resilience, and overcome everyday challenges and more stressful situations and transitions. You can access other Sesame Street resilience materials online, at sesamestreet.org/challenges

This app aims to teach Sesame’s “Breathe, Think, Do” strategy for problem-solving. The app is part of Sesame Street’s Little Children, Big Challenges initiative, which aims to provide tools to help children build skills for resilience, and overcome everyday challenges and more stressful situations and transitions. You can access other Sesame Street resilience materials online, at sesamestreet.org/challenges
summary: This app aims to help teach your child real-world problem solving skills.

So so helpful for both my autistic 4 year old and my neurotypical 2 year old daughter
Great for my son with autism. It helps him when he gets upset.

Breathe Think Do with Sesame Street is Cool. Overall, I Give this Game 4.8 Stars. Awesome ! I Love Breathe Think Do with Sesame Street . This game is ok. No updates for obvious problems since 2016. It's a shame it fell to the wayside, what a great idea it was. It's not as if Jim Henson inc. is short on funding. title: Can Knockdown 3
description:
Be accurate! Be smart! Be quick!

Challenge your aim, hone your precision, and push your puzzle-solving skills to the next level in this insanely addictive game. This installment takes the critically acclaimed Can Knockdown series to all new heights- the physics-based carnival gameplay you know and love- and adds unique puzzles, adrenaline-charged challenges, and even more explosive action! 

A SMASH hit series! 

Over 30 million downloads and still going strong! This latest edition has even more awesome features: 

• Multiple challenging levels in beautiful 3D locations 
• Puzzles from Easy to Tricky… can you knock them ALL down? 
• Show off your skills and challenge your friends! 
• Multiple achievements and badges… collect them ALL!

This game is hours & hours of upbeat and challenging fun! The realism of both graphics & sound (including the cheers & comments from the crowd) are exceptional!

title: Force Stop Apps (No root)
description:
Usually our phones run many apps in the background. Sometimes we don't need them running because we hate those annoying notifications. Not only will this APP help you stop them and make your phone faster and more power-efficient!

TASK KILLER
This APP stops other apps at the process level, so it can kill the task.

SPEED BOOSTER & RAM CLEANER
The phone runs faster because it stops many useless processes.

BATTERY SAVER
Reducing APP runs can also save power.

CPU COOLER
Stopping the useless apps can also reduce CPU usage and cool it down.

Permissions & Privacy
This app uses Accessibility services. When you use it, you may receive privacy warnings, this is a standard procedure on all Android OS when enabling Accessibility Services. 
This app will NOT collect any personal data.

recentChanges: fix bug
comments: I appreciate developers for this app. But I have noticed the battery optimization in battery settings in my Android is sufficient to save the battery. It even warns me if any app is consuming the battery so I can then force stop if required. There is no any need to use other battery saving app (at least in my Android). This app might be useful to save RAM, but my Android also handles this fluently ☺️.

This app is the only one that I've found that perfectly force stops the apps. Then as it exists it force stops itself. If you go into settings you see that it all worked. Crazy an app actually does what it says it will do with no bs. This app deserves more then 5 stars. It literally saves me massive amounts of time doing this manually.

Great App. It force closes every app running on my phone. I didn't realize how many apps run in background with my knowledge. Helps not drain my battery and helps phone run faster. Only complaint I have is that when it is force closing all my apps it ALWAYS (every single time) gets hung up on Amazon Apps. Sometimes I have to force close the app and run it again. I do like after it runs full list of apps it is force closing, it force closes itself!

Works great for closing apps that it actually lists. Unfortunately it does not scan/list many many apps that are installed. It stops manually downloaded apps, and you can set "System apps", but it totally ignores preinstalled apps. There's prolly 30 apps on my phone that this app won't pick up. Still, this is THE best no-root force stopper.

Does what it says and that's it. BRILL! Just be careful what you close down. It can close down services that allow the Android wear to communicate with your devices. But does what it says efficiently, and even revokes it's app permission that you have to set to automate the process, which is a nice help to strengthen your privacy.

title: Writer Plus (Write On the Go)
description:
Writer Plus is a handy writer app allowing creative writers to jot down quick points.

Writer Plus is a writing application without the fuss and distraction of a traditional word processor. Writer Plus is perfect for writing notes, novel, lyrics, poems, essay, draft on your phone or tablet.

Writer Plus' philosophy is Keep it Simple. Writer Plus tries to be as basic as possible, giving you somewhere to turn your thoughts into text, markdown support. Nothing more. Nothing less.

Try Writer Plus with features:
☆ Open, Edit, Save plain text file  
☆ Folder support
☆ Keyboard shortcuts
☆ Markdown format
☆ Word and Character Count
☆ Undo & Redo
☆ Share
☆ Night Mode
☆ Android Material UI style
☆ Right to left support
☆ Robust and Stable, High performance
☆ Battery friendly, Limited system resource usage
☆ Absolutely FREE! Great support!

Writer Plus supports Bluetooth Keyboard and some edit shortcuts:
☆ ctrl + a : select all
☆ ctrl + c : copy
☆ ctrl + v : paste
☆ ctrl + x : cut
☆ ctrl + z : undo
☆ ctrl + y : redo
☆ ctrl + s : save
☆ ctrl + f : share


Supported Languages:
- English
- Chinese
- German
- Italian
- French
- Russian
- Spanish
- Portuguese
- Polish

Note: Writer Plus stores files in the /Writer/ of the external card  (On most devices it means SD card, others means a partition of the main flash.).

!!! Some Junk Clean apps may delete files in /Writer directory, please use it carefully!!! 

Markdown is a lightweight markup language with plain text formatting syntax. Writer Plus supports:

- H1, H2, H3
- Italic & Bold
- List & Numbered List
- Quote

Regarding Markdown format, please refer to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Markdown

Let us know if you have any suggestion
- Google Plus Community: https://plus.google.com/communities/112303838329340209656
- Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/writerplus
- Email: support@writer.plus

comments: I am very satisfied with this app overall performance. It is great ad free app. But, i want to point out two things: 1. The cursor. I don't want to explain it everyone knows it. 2. The cloud backup option is not available, which is just frustrating in case of accidental breakage of your smartphone. I have request with the developer that please atleast provide this function or you can give us option to backup the contents by making them ZIP file. It will be a great help then.

when I first got this app a year ago I was really glad that it worked so well. it never lagged, it operated smoothly, and it didn't have ads. however, after almost two years, this app has changed drastically. to start, it lags a lot. I press a button and it won't show up with options for a few minutes, making it difficult for me to get drafts done. the app also doesn't operate as smoothly due to the lagging. I hope this is fixed in future updates.

This is an amazing apps for authors who want to look for a simplified UI. However, I do wanna point out the problems with an external keyboard. When I connect a physical keyboard, the blinking cursor would not appear, unlike when you use your Android keyboard. It can get annoying sometimes, as you would have no idea where you're typing, and it's just that you get used to have a blinking cursor while typing, it feels off. 9/10 for design, -1 for the bugs. Really great and user friendly.

I've been using this app for several years and it's easy to use. No complaints at all. Saves automatically when you close it. My only wish for it would be to make it easier to back it all up regularly. But taking the extra time to convert each piece of writing and so it that way is nothing to villain about for a free app without ads

Quite user-friendly, useful and space saving app for writing. Was mistaken, write to SD card is supported. But how come no upgrade version after such a long while? The developer did a great job, without any doubts. Unfortunately, couldn't find the companion app, Writer Sync for storage on Google Drive any more. Why? Please update app and integrate the sync to Google Drive feature. Thank you.

title: SmokeFree - quit smoking slowly
description:
This app gives you two options to quit - if you are highly motivated you can choose quit mode and if you need more time there is reduce mode.

SmokeFree app can be your companion in process of quitting - it can help you slowly reduce the amount of cigarettes per day, keep your cessation stress, nicotine cravings in normal and let you body adapt to less cigarettes daily, until you completely stop. This way you can accommodate with non-smoker life again. The most important thing is your desire to stop smoking.

Why should you try this method?
This app provides method that is different from just saying I won’t smoke anymore - that’s really hard. Reduction of nicotine, and stress from no-smoking are coming in small doses here. With smaller portions of nicotine turkey and need for cigarette it is easier to adapt to life without cigarette and then completely quit.

Remember: Desire to quit smoking is most important. You can do it! :-)

Features
• Create your own quitting plan
• Track your progress
• Rich motivational tips with videos, images and quotes
• Personal goals expressed as money saved, quit days or cigarettes skipped
• Your loved ones are your motivators
• Widget on home screen for easier access
• Designed for smartwatches (Android Wear)
• DashClock widget
• Data synchronization between all your devices
• Facebook integration - like, share and send


Wear application
This application is designed for Android Wear. After you set up parameters on your mobile device, you are ready to use wearable application. Tap smoke action on notification when you smoke. Search for settings on mobile device to control behavior of wearable notification. You can also open SmokeFree wearable application and tap when screen is green. Both mobile and wear applications can work when devices are not connected. Data is automatically synced when devices connect.


Check out SmokeFree Facebook page at http://www.facebook.com/pages/SmokeFree/1531303633774253

comments: This is a fantastic app for helping you step down a day by day basis. I have cut down from 30 a day 15 already! The only things that I think would make it better is the ability to share the progress chart and maybe the choice of a widgit or notification option to alert you when you can have your next cig according to the programme. I have noticed a few times that I look and see I have another 20 minutes to go but then I'm trying not to clock watch as I get stressed out that way. Thank you!!

Very useful. Helps to control how many cigaretes you smoke at the start. I hope it will help me to quit as well. Notifications works fine for me .You just have to go to settings and change the sound from silence to any sound you want. 5 star because is simple and easy

it's the best anti smoking app i've seen, i downloaded a bunch of others but they all work the same way, by cutting out smoking completely and giving you achievements and stats on how well youre doing, anyone who has tried to quit can tell you this doesnt work. this app reduces the times you smoke gradually making it so much more easy

It is an amazing application that is making me reduce smoking but there is one issue i cannot change the notification tone, i am changing the tone but it still uses the default tone i don't know what to do.

The app itself is helpful. Not pushy or accidentally judgemental like the other quit smoking apps. But the biggest problems are 1) notifications don't seem to work and 2) The super awesome widget (my fav feature) is useless because it doesn't update unless you go into the app, and sometimes not even then. Which kind of makes the widget useless.

- Only 8 ads in the entire game and no in app purchases!

Cats are Liquid - A Light in the Shadows is a 2D platformer about a cat with the ability to transform into liquid.

The game has 90 levels, that are spread across 9 different worlds. It has a minimalistic but colorful style. Along the way the game introduces new mechanics, like flying and summoning bombs to break down walls.

The story is about a cat whose owner locked her in a set of rooms. She desperately wants to get out, but the rooms just keep continuing. Along the way the cat meets a new "friend" and gains new abilities. The story is told through small in game text pieces.

The latest news about the game can be found on the @lastquarterdev Twitter feed.

comments: one of the best games! it has an awesome yet sad story, and it sometimes makes you rage. the game is from 2015, so what would you expect from the graphics? its good enough. SPOILERS AHEAD, READ AT YOUR OWN RISK! in the last room, Lumi (cats name) says "why did i create this?" and "why did i lock myself in here?" this is why the cat is the owner herself.

Contrary to the third quote of world 3 room 1, This game is amazing! The physics work perfectly and the levels are fun. It's creative with all the mechanics and as a bonus: It's cute! My only problem is that there could be more of a story, But besides that, This game is 11/10 and I can't wait to finish it and play the sequel. Edit: after playing and finishing the sequel, I can safely say that this game is easier, but more enjoyable than Cats are Liquid 2. Still they are both amazing!

It's vary simple and easy to use. I also find it dosnt stress me as much as most games too so it's good as a relaxing game. I really sogest it and it's likely you'll enjoy it. The only downside is that some of the movements are a bit slow but that can also help you. It also is simple but looks really good.

I love this. Quite possibly the best mobile game I've ever played. It's fairly easy most of the time, but I would argue this works very much in it's favor-- the gameplay is very calming, with very fluid and free movement. The story fits well with the atmosphere, and is surprisingly engaging. A lot of what exactly happened is left up to interpretation. But my favorite thing about it is the hidden appearances of purple cat, and I really wish there were more little things like that.

This is honestly one of the best games I have ever played. In all the hundreds of apps I have reviewed, this is the 1st to get 5 stars. The story is good, it looks good, everything is very smooth, controls are easy. I finished the game in a day because I wouldn't leave my computer. [I have to finish all of the games to review them.] Please get this game, the developers deserve a good pat on the back. I love this game and will be reviewing the 2nd one soon, yes, I like it that much! -TheReviewee

Smash obstacles and targets in your path and experience the best destruction physics on mobile devices now! This experience requires focus, concentration, and timing to break the beautiful objects that stand in your way.
